text: The 2006 Portuguese presidential election was held on 22 January to elect a new president to succeed Jorge Sampaio, who was term-limited. Aníbal Cavaco Silva of the Social Democratic Party candidate, the former Prime Minister, won 50.54 percent of the vote in the first round. It was the first time a right- wing candidate was elected President since the 1974 Carnation Revolution. == Results == Summary of the 22 January 2006 Portuguese presidential election results |-
